thread.title: danjmartin published Tories pick 24 year-old teacher Jack Hickey to face Liz Kendall...
thread.title_full: danjmartin published Tories pick 24 year-old teacher Jack Hickey to face Liz Kendall...

author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin published Tories pick 24 year-old teacher Jack Hickey to face Liz Kendall...
text:
Tories pick 24 year-old teacher Jack Hickey to face Liz Kendall in Leicester West election battle By danjmartin | Posted: April 28, 2017 1 COMMENTS SHARES Jack Hickey has been selected as the Tories' Leicester West General Election candidate Tories pick 24 year-old teacher Jack Hickey to face Liz Kendall in Leicester... X 
Copy link to paste in your message / 
Teacher Jack Hickey has been chosen to take on Labour's Leicester West MP Liz Kendall in the General Election . 
Leicester's Tories have tonight selected the 24-year-old to contest the seat on June 8. 
The Mercury understands Mr Hickey beat shortlisted Edward He Ye and Jackson Ng to the candidacy in a behind-closed-doors selection meeting in the constituency. 
Mr Hickey, from Thurnby Lodge, is the chairman of the Leicester Conservative Association. 
He tonight told the Mercury: "As a local lad I am delighted to be standing as the Conservative candidate for Leicester West and will be campaigning day and night over the next six weeks. 
"It is about time that local people have an MP who can really put their needs first and if elected I will be a champion for Leicester West in Westminster. 
"Only a vote for the Conservatives on June 8 can secure Theresa May's strong and stable leadership and allow the Government to negotiate the best possible Brexit deal for both Leicester and Britain. 
"The alternative is Jeremy Corbyn as Prime Minister propped up by others, including the SNP, in a coalition of chaos." 
General Election 2017: Click HERE for everything you need to know 
The Mercury understands the Tories are targeting seats with Labour majorities of under 8,000 which includes Leicester West where Ms Kendall has a 7,203 majority to protect. 
It is also understood Tory MPs in Leicestershire seemingly safe seats have been instructed to spend 20 per cent of their time during the campaign in Leicester West bolstering the bid to unseat Ms Kendall. 
A Conservative source told the Mercury Leicester West was 'high on the radar' as a potentially winnable seat on June 8. 
Ms Kendall previously told the Mercury: "I am looking forward to the campaign. 
"I will be fighting for every vote on my track record of working to save the Glenfield heart unit and campaigning against school funding cuts. 
"I believe I am the best person to represent the people of Leicester West and I can't wait to get out into the community on the campaign trail." 
The Lib Dems have today announced Ian Bradwell will be their Leicester West candidate. 
The 53-year-old is blind, lives in Braunstone, has worked in local community radio and was a resident director for the Braunstone Community Association and has chaired the Leicester Disabled Persons Access Group. 
He was Lib Dem candidate in Leicester West in 2015 but won secured only 1,500 votes and came fifth. 
The Lid Dems have also selected their candidates to contest Leicester other two constituencies. 
Special needs teacher Nitesh Dave will take on Labour's Keith Vaz in Leicester East. 
Harrish Bisnauthsing will challenge Labour's Jon Ashworth in Leicester South. 
Mr Bisnauthing is a computer engineer from Stamford in Lincolnshire, according to the Liberal Democrat website.
